metadata.title: CVE-2016-5733 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in phpMyAdmin 4.0.xbefore 4.0.10.16, 4.4.x before 4.4.15.7, and 4.6.x before 4.6.3 allowremote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via vectorsinvolving (1) a crafted table name that is mishandled during privilegechecking in table_row.phtml, (2) a crafted mysqld log_bin directive that ismishandled in log_selector.phtml, (3) the Transformation implementation,(4) AJAX error handling in js/ajax.js, (5) the Designer implementation, (6)the charts implementation in js/tbl_chart.js, or (7) the zoom-searchimplementation in rows_zoom.phtml.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5733` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

phpmyadmin - 4:4.6.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: phpmyadmin package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:4.6.3-1').
